definition[0]: to take someone somewhere, especially when you are protecting or guarding them
example[0]: The shipment was escorted by guards.
example[2]: I escorted her to the door.
definition[1]: to go with someone and show them a place
example[3]: The company escorts prospective buyers around the property.
definition[2]: to go with someone to a social event
example[4]: Bill escorted Ellie to the opera.
definition[3]: a person or a group of people or vehicles that go with someone in order to protect or guard them
example[6]: He was driven away to prison under armed escort  (=protected or guarded by an escort).
definition[4]: someone who goes with someone to a formal social event
definition[5]: someone who is paid to go out with someone socially
definition[6]: a prostitute, especially one who goes to social events or on trips with the person who pays them
definition[7]: a middle-sized car that used to be made by Ford and sold especially in the UK and Europe
